About Me

Hi, my name's Yu Wang and I'm a master student in computer science at Georgia Tech. Before I came to Georgia Tech, I obtained my B.S. and M.S. in systems and industrial engineering from University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign (GPA 3.7/4.0). I was part of parasol lab and got involved with research about motion planning of robotics. I had passion in machine learning and robotics.

Research

Sampling Based Guided Search

Parasol lab at U of I, Champaign, IL

Aug 2023 - Mar 2024

  • Assisted the research to build a motion planning framework that biased search based on past experience
  • Participated in creating the fundamental tree database which obtained annotated values for nodes with different deep neural networks
  • Implemented a heuristic search baseline that adopted cost-to-go value to bias the search in different test environments as a comparison to the proposed model

Hierarchical Discrete Representation Learning

Parasol lab at U of I, Champaign, IL

Nov 2022 - May 2023

  • Participated in the research of developing hierarchical discrete representation learning with abstraction states for states and actions.
  • Worked on data transmission pipeline with mujoco viewer and gym wrapper to process the camera viewer input to output multiple perspectives based on user settings
  • Implemented the baseline method SAC with gumble softmax to explore discrete state and action environment to compare performance with proposed framework
